attributes.action: Consider recommissioning fallout shelters in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: A Donald Trump presidency will introduce a large element of unpredictability into geopolitics. We as a nation need to take steps to prepare ourselves for every eventuality, up to and including nuclear war.
attributes.additional_details: Our network of Nuclear shelters has fallen out of use following the close of the Cold War. With sites such as Burlington falling into disrepair. These sites are located within many of our towns and cities and would provide a small measure of safety and the continuation of the British way of life in the event of a disaster.

attributes.action: The local education authority should be put back in charge of schools.
attributes.background: I have had an issue with my daughters primary school head and where ever I go to complain I'm told I must go through the Govenors which is pointless as they are all directed by the headteacher, who is not answerable to anyone

attributes.action: Keep Bishop Auckland urgent care open
attributes.background: They are proposing that they close the urgent care centre in bishop hospital. It is a vital service which has saved two members of my own family and possibly thousands more.
attributes.additional_details: We need to keep it open for the benefit of the population of bishop and surrounding areas. If it closes then I can imagine that death rate would increase dramatically

attributes.action: Call for an independent review of the recent local government finance settlement
attributes.background: “The Government announced a £300m fund to help ease the pain of the cuts, but instead of giving it to areas that have had the biggest cuts, they gave it to wealthier areas run by Conservative councils that have had the least cuts since 2010.
attributes.additional_details: After complaints that Government funding cuts were too severe, the Government announced a £300m ‘relief fund’ to help affected areas.  But instead of targeting the money on areas with the biggest cuts, 85% of it has been sent to areas with the lowest levels of deprivation that have experienced the least cuts. Most of these areas are run by Conservative councils. There are concerns public money was used as a political fix to buy votes for the Tories in the run-up to elections in May.

attributes.action: Bring licensing back for dogs and cats UK. A cost of £1 per year per animal.
attributes.background: Dog licensing was abolished in 1984, in most countries it is mandatory to have a license for an animal you own. It is like registering a car to the legal owner. If an animal was to stray or get run over alongside the new microchipping laws, there would be a greater chance of getting a pet back home.
attributes.additional_details: All registrations would begin on 6th April, and must be renewed by 31 March, every year. Each registered dog or cat must wear a tag specifying the council, registration expiry date, and registration number of the dog, with the colour of the tag changing every year for easy identification .  Fees for working dogs (herding dogs, police dogs, drug dogs, etc.) are generally lower than for pets, and seeing-eye or hearing-ear dogs would be  free or minimal cost to register.

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to children only residing in the UK
attributes.background: Child benefit should only be paid to children whilst they live and receive full time education in the UK

attributes.action: Allow buyer to retain 5% of new build house price until build quality is correct
attributes.background: I am a new home owner. A year after moving in, I am fighting the house builder to complete my home to a satisfactory standard. Many of my neighbours are in a similar position. An incentive must be provided for the house builder to complete the house to the required quality standards.
attributes.additional_details: The house builder currently is paid the full amount of the house on exchange no matter how poor the quality of house delivered. New home buyers need more protection - the 10 year warranty is not sufficient to protect against poor quality. If the home buyer can retain 5% of the purchase price, then if the home builder cannot deliver the home to the required cosmetic and structural quality (which can be independently verified), then the home buyer should be allowed to keep the retained capital.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close Bedford ​Magistrates' Court.
attributes.background: The county town of Bedfordshire is slowly losing its identity.  Our court building with its imposing façade demands respect for the justice deliberated within its walls. To take this away, will rip more of the soul from our town. When will central Government consult us taxpayers?
attributes.additional_details:
Mayor of Bedford Dave Hodgson said: "It will make permanent the delays to the administration of justice that we've seen already. Alongside the threat to the future of the hospital as we know it and the punitive cuts to the council's funding, this is part of a sustained assault on local services."

Read more: http://www.bedfordshire-news.co.uk/8203-Magistrates-closure-undermines-justice/story-28724251-detail/story.html#ixzz40Gt3ljWW

attributes.action: Stop charging patients for recreational services in hospitals.
attributes.background:
In hospitals, patients have to pay money to use recreational services offered such as TVs. 

Electricity is wasted to power the TVs to show adverts, yet the patients have to pay money if they want to watch a film or channel.
attributes.additional_details:
It is immoral to be charging a patient for recreational services when they have already been installed and are already using electricity to display adverts. 

Being entertained is an essential element of human biology and psychology, so why are patients being denied of that? 

A compromise for not making TVs free would be to provide free books, magazines, or games which could be donated to the hospital by people.

attributes.action: Ban unsolicited physical post (Junk mail)
attributes.background:
We get a ridiculous amount of unsolicited post on a daily basis. Most of us put it straight in the bin without even looking at it. 
If it were banned, we'd all be less irritated, and the UK's carbon footprint will get a significant reduction.

attributes.action: Review how child maintenance is calculated for self employed fathers
attributes.background: Self employed fathers pay far less than employed fathers and by unrealistic calculations. Self employed figures are based on profit after travelling expenses, vehicle finance, fuel and telephone etc are deducted from their gross figure. Employed fathers who earn less gross pay far more
attributes.additional_details: An employed father who earns £500 gross per week would pay £100.00 per week. He would also have same traveling and living expenses as the self employed father yet this is not taken into account. Too many self employed fathers abuse this system as an excuse to take little financial responsibility for their children. In most cases the self employed are living high standards of living whilst employed fathers struggle with general living. Self employed fathers should be calculated on realisticly

attributes.action: Save Age UK Training Center, Preston, Lancashire
attributes.background: The petition is to protest against the EFA/SFA closing down the center due to a failed Ofsted report (in which they did not even come to our center). Jobs will be lost as well as training opportunities for the 16-19 year olds that attend Age UK, most of which struggle with the usual college system.
attributes.additional_details: Age UK is the last training center of its kind based in Preston with specific targeted courses for the students, such as Business Admin and Maths training. It is a small environment designed to help students less suited to a large college environment and an alternative to college for over a decade. 16-19 Year old learners that have various issues ranging from anxiety to social skills will no longer have anywhere to gain education as Age UK Training was the last trainer of this sort in Preston.

attributes.action: give our homeless and ex service men and women homes before asylum seekers
attributes.background: our homeless and ex service men and women need home more then asylum seekers you can walk around any town or city and you will see how many homeless men and women are around yet when an asylum seekers comes to the uk there house is ready and waiting and I and a lot of over people think this is wrong
attributes.additional_details: my evidence is all around as someone who has been homeless I know the struggles and to be told it will take 5 years plus to get a flat/house is wrong yet asylum seekers can be given a property within the first 24 hours after arriving we need to get our own people sorted before we can even think about helping anyone else

attributes.action: Legally require adjacent schools to align their school holiday schedule.
attributes.background: Adjacent schools, serving different age groups, are attended by siblings from one family. Misaligned school holidays mean: the family cannot take a holiday & financial hardship as the parents have to cover childcare for four weeks instead of two (i.e. time away from work or child care costs).
attributes.additional_details: Further impacts include: less revenue to the British tourism industry, inconveniencing employers and preventing/further discouraging mothers from working thus claiming benefits. Schools are allowed to fine parents if children do not attend, yet schools are under no obligation to consider the constraints of working parents. Aligning the school holidays causes schools literally no inconvenience what so ever.

attributes.action: Raise the BMI cap for fertility treatment
attributes.background:
Currently only women with a BMI of 30 or lower is eligible for fertility treatment.
It has been proven that the BMI system is flawed and does not take bone density etc. into account
attributes.additional_details: I believe that there are many women who have successful pregnancies with a BMI over 30 who are fortunate to not have a fertility problem therefore why should women who have conditions such as PCOS (where it is proven that it is harder to maintain or lose weight with this condition) be penalised and rejected when they are the people who really need the treatment.

attributes.action: Introduce a regulatory body for housing officers!
attributes.background: Over the past year of assisting people, I have noticed, along with others that there is a pattern emerging of housing officers abusing their power and not being held to account for their actions.
attributes.additional_details: The ONLY case for this that was ever brought forward was AA v London Borough Southwark [2014], where 3 housing officers were found guilty of conspiracy and misfeasance in a public office. More need held to account and the only way we can do this is to have a regulatory body for ALL housing officers!

attributes.action: Make schools expelling pupils for coloured hair and piercings illegal
attributes.background: Many schools have discriminated against their pupils for having coloured hair and piercings in school.  Expelling pupils for this stops pupils expressing themselves.  The point is raised on equality and bullying, however many people have coloured hair now so it won't cause issues
attributes.additional_details: We hope that the government will understand that self expression is important to teenagers and that by expelling pupils for this is harmful.

attributes.action: Stop all fossil fuel grants use the money to create tech to take CO2 out the air
attributes.background: The enegy and fossil fuel industries receive millions in government subsidies, ranging from tax allowances to direct price subsidy.  This is also the case in ancillary inductries, for example diesel engine production. Consumers pay on their energy bills for above market prices and additional taxes
attributes.additional_details: Theres hould be no energy price subsidy in a free market, the renewables obligation monies be used for a positive outcome.  The world has continued to warm, CO2 emissions continue and will continue.  New technology is needed now to take CO2 from the atmosphere.  Britain could become a world leader in this new technology, and make a new industry from scratch creating wealth and opportunity for UK PLC, and not take money from the poorest in our society with no tangible benefit. Christopher age 12.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to falsify or ignore parental responsibility.
attributes.background: It is possible to remove or move a child from school/education authority without the application being checked for parental responsibility. I wish to make it a criminal offence to not declare parental responsibility. I also would like to make the school authority board not checking libel.

attributes.action: Force councils to pay compensation after incorrectly issuing a parking ticket.
attributes.background: Currently there is no financial penalty for councils to quality control the issuance of parking tickets.  This results in a high number of tickets being issued erroneously and causing stress to the receiver of the incorrect ticket.  Forcing councils to pay out compensation counteracts this.

attributes.action: MAKE ASTHMA and ANGINA MEDICATIONS EXEMPT FROM NHS PRESCRIPTION CHARGES
attributes.background: Like other life threatening conditions, unless medicated the risk of a simple Asthma attack or Heart Attack turning into something much more serious, this is why many rely on their medications on a daily basis, like Diabetes for example

attributes.action: Remove the Barnett Formula from being applied in the UK
attributes.background: The Barnett Formula does not conform with modern equality as it allow some groups to benefit and others not. We should all be subject to the same rules
attributes.additional_details: No evidence is needed as all facts are published by the UK government

attributes.action: Put Food Technology back on the A and AS level options.
attributes.background: My friend wants to become a chef when she graduates university, however without an A level course in Food Technology she feels as though other older candidates, who had the option of this course, will be better prepared for the job, therefore more likely to be hired.

attributes.action: Only allow people who have served in the British Armed forces to vote.
attributes.background: Someone who has served their country and have been prepared to lay down their life should be allowed to vote. Therefore it should be a requirement that a person serves a minimum of 3 years in the armed forces to be eligible to vote in an election or referendum.

attributes.action: Bring VAT back down to 15% immediately after EU exit has been completed
attributes.background: Give honest working UK tax payers and families a much needed economical boost and shot in the arm. With new global trade deals now possible and a recouped EU membership bill lets force competition in the market place and give the consumer a chance to really contribute to incrrasing overall GDP

attributes.action: Companies/organisations fined for hate speech in uniform/insignia or on premises
attributes.background: As a deterrant against post-referendum racism and to encourage a wider sense of collective social responsibility, we believe that penalty fines should be served on registered companies and organisations that own the uniform, insignia, premises or property in/with which an act of hate speech occurs.

attributes.action: Hold a new EU referendum if there is a major shift in public opinion.
attributes.background: The consequences of leave have, until now, been pure speculation.  They are now facts and becoming clear: a fall in the pound, threatened major job losses, the break up of the UK.  Had these consequences been clear before the vote, the public may have voted differently and should confirm the vote.

attributes.action: A referendum should not be retaken for the same issue for at least 10years
attributes.background:
Following the recent vote leave result, a law should be passed preventing the Re-Polling of the same subject for a minimum period of time. I suggest this should be 10 years. 
Once the general public have had their democratic say, this should not be undermined by a second referendum.

attributes.action: A second referendum should be carried out in the event that the EU reforms.
attributes.background: Due to fears of other countries exiting the EU, a reformation may take place within the union. If this does occur, then the UK should have another opportunity to decide whether it wishes to remain in a reformed EU or not, prior to the triggering of Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland may well be having another referendum for their independence due to the changed circumstances between the UK and the EU. Similarly, should EU reformation occur, the circumstances will  have changed. Therefore, the UK should be given the opportunity to have a new referendum on its membership in the EU.

This should be carried out prior to the triggering of Article 50 to ensure that our position and influence in the EU is maintained.

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Make a second EU referendum not up for debate for four years.
attributes.background:
The humans of the United Kingdom won a Democratic Vote to LEAVE the European Union. 

Please ensure by a legally binding contract all referendums on the same political-economical topic have four year gaps. We cannot have a second European Union referendum this close to the first.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Respect for moralistic democracy 
2. Post-pone second referendum for 4 years
3. Over-rule petition for second European Union referendum that is desired for this year.

attributes.action: Demand a re-evaluation of the Barnett Formula in the wake of leaving the EU
attributes.background: Due to gross inequality in the funding of the home nations by Westminister thus far, extra help from the EU pot has been essential in order to help some regions of the UK to thrive. Now that we've voted to leave, the Barnett Formula must be re-evaluated and modified to meet the needs of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Devolution: What's the Barnett formula? - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-29477233

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Prime Minister & the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
attributes.background:
Many electorate find the PM's behaviour & that of the Chancellor in the EU Referendum run up well below the standards expected of holders of high office.

Speculation, "Project Fear" & blackmail threats of raising taxes if we vote leave fall below what ordinary people require of their leaders.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where provided
attributes.background: Cycle paths are created and funded for one sole reason, safety to cyclists and motorists, where provided it should be a legal requirement for cyclists to use the cycle paths to reduce danger to them and motorists on UK roads, especially those which are 60mph speed limits.

attributes.action: Review campaign rules / media regulation on stigmatisation of demographic groups
attributes.background: In the UK, loosely regulated media and political propaganda has been used extensively to stigmatise and marginalise demographics, particularly those in minority groups. More should be done to protect groups and individuals from becoming targets for political or financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Media content and political campaigns, including headlines, tag lines, articles or information and imagery, specifically taken out of context or construed with the intention to promote concern, fear and isolation of any group or culture that exists fairly under UK law, should be regulated to protect the public from attacks of violence and hatred.

attributes.action: Raise a vote on no confidence in the Chancellor
attributes.background:
In the run up to the EU Referendum the Chancellor has acted in an irresponsible manner.

This petition is to raise a vote on no confidence on behalf of the public whom he represents. His behaviour is irresponsible and is misleading the British public.

attributes.action: The government to put political pressure on the US to impose gun restrictions.
attributes.background: It is embarrassing for our nation to be in a close relationship with a country that refuses to put the safety of its citizens first. Today yet another mass shooting has taken place and over 50 members of the LGBT community have died. We can not support any government that allows this to happen.

attributes.action: Call on UEFA to ban & send Russian Fans home after violence against England fans
attributes.background: We clearly see evidence of Russian fans attacking England supporters. We believe that violence has no place in football. We're fed up of being highlighted as trouble makers. UEFA should send Russian fans home for their poor display towards other human beings to which the ECHR holds dear.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/HooligansTVi/videos/593950987452298/

attributes.action: Debate local community bank closures
attributes.background: It is time for a debate in parliament on the issue of closing small bank branches especially in rural areas. In England the HSBC is cutting rural branches and in Scotland it is the Royal Bank and the Clydesdale Bank. This must be stopped now..
attributes.additional_details:
Customers are paying the price for banks giving poor financial advice in the past by seeing the closure of smaller branches especially in rural areas.

These proposed closures effect a wide range of people from local businesses to those who are not internet savvy. 

These changes mean that people will no longer have face to face contact with real people. Should they want this contact they will have to travel some considerable distances to a larger branch to deposit cash or pay in cheques.

attributes.action: Postpone EU Referendum so Parliament can debate PM's/Chancellor Disaster Claims
attributes.background: The Prime Minister and Chancellor (and official bodies) have argued that a Brexit vote in the EU Referendum would be a disaster for the UK. The Cabinet and Parliament should have debated and agreed the consequences before a Referendum was actioned.  The PM, Chancellor and Cabinet are negligent.

attributes.action: To promote the creation of, and eventually join a united, single nation EU
attributes.background: For centuries, wars started and fueled by Nationalism, rivalry and hatred have ravaged Europe, allowing others to surpass Europe. Now we must trancend rivalry and Nationalism, much like China, and unify to stand more powerful on the world's stage. Continued in additional details.
attributes.additional_details: With a united EU the problems initially seen with the Euro would be ironed out, with a united fiscal and monetary policy. Allowing Europe to stand up to superpowers such as China and the US. While retaining through federalism the rights British citizens would expect.

attributes.action: Make it legal for public facilities to keep a record of lost children.
attributes.background:
Did you know that there is no national lost child policy here in the UK?
Public facilities have no legal obligation to keep a record of lost children, so they could not tell you how often it occurs in their facilities and how long it took to reunite a lost child with it’s parent or guardian.
attributes.additional_details:
In recent surveys carried out;

1 in 5 children get lost or separated from their Parent/Guardian whilst on holiday each year. (Childline-NSPCC)

1 child is reported lost or missing every 3 minutes (Missingkids)

Almost 2 out of every 3 British Adults would hesitate to help a lost child because they fear being falsely accused of something sinister (Reuters)

In the last 2 years we have discovered that there is not one standard lost child policy in place throughout the UK (FollowtheBear.co.uk)

attributes.action:
Ban 0845 type numbers
Stop service providers charging customers contacting them
attributes.background:
Essential utility and service providers charge customers who need to contact them by phone
Identifying, reporting and resolving service delivery problems is an integral part of their business and should not constitute an additional source of revenue.
customer contact must be free - eg 0800 numbers
attributes.additional_details:
National service providers should provide customers who buy their utilities or products with free vectors of direct communication.  It is unethical to charge paying customers additional fees to speak to their service providers.
These, and other barriers to communication, serve to discourage customers from raising complaints and identifying problems. Opportunities for utility providers to monitor and maintain  service quality and delivery is therefore unfairly restricted and limited.

attributes.action: Introduce a rule to prevent the trading of insults and irrelevant remarks at PMQ
attributes.background: The Prime Minister as an elected public official and head of the UK government, responsible for the policy and decisions of the government should not be using PMQ as an opportunity to trade insults and to make irrelevant remarks that do not relate to questions posed.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months responses, quality of debate and the PM's behaviour at PMQ has reached a level that is now unacceptable, as it condones behaviour that would not be accepted in other spheres of society or workplace. The House of Parliament is a working environment, in which MPs of all parties are paid by UK tax payers to govern and formulate policies to benefit society, therefore it is right and proper that questions asked at PMQ are answered in a respectful manner.

attributes.action: lower the minimum working age to 12 years old
attributes.background: at the moment the minimum working age is 14 and we think that it should be lower as it gives younger children real life experience and it gives the children a chance to earn money.

attributes.action: Increase the resources allocated to child protection.  No more Ayeeshia's!
attributes.background: The case of Ayeeshia Smith is far from isolated. 1 child PER WEEK is murdered by their parent(s) in the UK. That simply has to stop. I'm calling on the Government to substantially increase the resources allocated to child social care and child protection, to try to make sure it never happens again
attributes.additional_details:
Ayeeshia Smith.  Baby Peter.
High profile names, for all the wrong reasons
But apparently, in the UK, one child per week is murdered by his or her parents.  Think about that: ONE CHILD PER WEEK KILLED BY THEIR PARENT(s).  Source:http://straightstatistics.fullfact.org/article/how-many-children-are-murdered-britain-every-year
In a supposedly civilised society, this simply cannot go on.  The government need to do whatever it takes - spend whatever is required - to make sure this never happens again

attributes.action: That UK Government GOES AHEAD with distributing its leaflet on EU membership.
attributes.background: The UK government has made its position clear on EU membership of the UK.  The electorate deserve to have details of this position in order to be better informed about what will be the most important decision the UK makes this century.

attributes.action: The UK to join the Eurozone
attributes.background: Without integration into the Eurozone the UK will always remain a fringe state of the European union, both economically and politically, with this integration tourism and trade between the other Eurozone countries will become more efficient and build stronger political ties with other major nations.

attributes.action: Reallocate BBC licence fee to assist with the Chancellors budget plan.
attributes.background: UK households are expected to pay £147.50 per year to own a television raking in £3.7bn quite frankly ridiculous in 2016 and compares to the window tax of 1696. Money that would be better spent elsewhere, NHS, Education.... the deficit? We pay it anyway, I suggest we spend it where its needed.
attributes.additional_details:
When the Chancellor is still looking to make cuts £3.7bn would go a long way to help balance the books.

BBC finances report 2013/14 that they took in £3.7bn from households in the UK up £16m from the previous year. 

Follow the downloadable link to 'Full finance statement 2013-14' page 4 http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/summary-financial-statement.html 

BBC Finances report 14/15 - http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/pdf/2014-15/bbc-annualreport-201415.pdf

attributes.action: Treat war pensions the same as the state pension, apply a triple lock increase.
attributes.background: The war pension scheme currently rises in line with the consumer price index measure of inflation.  The state old age pension rises by 2.5% or in line with average pay increases.
